text: Themes is a 1989 compilation album of works by Greek electronic composer and artist Vangelis. It featured some previously released tracks from Vangelis's other albums, as well as some pieces from movie soundtracks that had not previously been released. The album is notable because it marked the first official appearances of Vangelis' music from the films Blade Runner, The Bounty, and Missing. Of these three film scores, only the Blade Runner soundtrack has since received an official release. ==Track listing== * "Memories of Green" from See You Later was used in the films Blade Runner and Someone to Watch Over Me. ==Charts== {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1989-1990) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|Australia |align="center"|46 |- |align="left"|Belgium |align="center"|39 |- |align="left"|Germany |align="center"|46 |- |align="left"|Sweden |align="center"|25 |- |align="left"|Switzerland |align="center"|20 |- |align="left"|UK Albums Chart |align="center"|11 |- |align="left"|Billboard New Age Albums |align="center"|10 |- |} ==Certifications== ==References== Category:1989 compilation albums Category:Vangelis compilation albums
title: Themes (Vangelis album)
